website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight and airy, the ALEADER is a breathable and flexible all-purpose amphibious water shoe.
pros: Quick-dry mesh upper drains quickly and dries fast
Thin but very durable fabric allows for multipurpose use, including hiking, kayaking, and walking over rocks
Better traction on wet surfaces than some models
Available in 15 different attractive styles and colors
cons: Can be narrow in the toe box for some users
Some people don’t like the plastic-type feel of the shoe

customer_reviews.title: My husband and I LOVED these when we traveled to Belize
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I LOVED these when we traveled to Belize. As a female (wearing a women's 10/11), I found the men's sizes very comfortable. They fit well over the top of my foot, but were slightly boxy in the toe box. My husband, with wider feet, found them slightly tight/narrow over the top of his foot. Overall they were great, held up well, drained and dried quickly, and were fairly stylish :)
customer_reviews.author: S_HIGGINS_CO

customer_reviews.title: Just buy a pair.
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought a similar pair last year, and rubbed it in my face all summer about how clean her feet where when we left the beach, and how I was full of sand. I have not used these yet, but I know they work because of her. I usually wear a 10 1/2 in Nike tennis shoes, and after reading several reviews, I went with a 10 in these.. Even for non-water use these are great. There is so much air flow; its like wearing sandals, but not having to look like a dork!
customer_reviews.author: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Great fit! So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I just got them today and tried them on. They fit perfectly. I was nervous because i have a giant foot for a girl (11)... so i ordered an 11 and they are perfect! Very comfy too... i will update in a few months when ill be giving them a really good test drive in the creeks of tennessee! :)
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2 under 2 :)

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, perfect fit, cool looking!
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES these water shoes. He is not the type to walk around with no socks on, he literally wears TWO pairs of socks EVERYDAY! But, he wore these the whole week while vacationing in Hawaii with NO SOCKS! He loves them. They're comfy and pretty awesome looking. We ordered him another pair to keep on our trailer that we store near the lake. Now he wears them every weekend while we're out boating.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Super happy with these
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with these. Wore them for a 3 day kayak/camping/hiking trip. Very comfortable, no blisters, good traction in shallow water on slippery rocks. Good traction on dry dirt/rock hikes. The only downside is that when walking on sand, the sand goes in the top very easily and its tough to get it back out once its in there. My cousin had on 5 toed viibrams and they would be the better investment, but at 5x the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robbyho

customer_reviews.title: Ok on fine sand but shoes become filled with small rocks on other terrain
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear at the beaches of Long Island. On the south shore, where the beaches are fine sand, they work great and I love them. On the north shore, the beaches are more fine rocks than sand. The soft rubbery material of which the shoes are constructed will fill up with stones that get stuck in them. They almost act like a stone sieve, with every hole filled with an appropriate sized rock jammed in the webbing. On the fine sand, or on mucky lakes, these are great. For stony beaches - not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Queens Determination

customer_reviews.title: Not for the beach, or hot footing
customer_reviews.text: Bought for wet landings in the Galapagos. Sand filtered inside and did not filter out. Larger pebbles stuck in bottom holes, blocking drainage. Not wearable on hot sand - hot sand gets in and roasts feet, no heat protection at all. Useless!
customer_reviews.author: Brevard customer

customer_reviews.title: Look good, priced good, NOT GOOD
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would be perfect for my vacation based off reviews. I even thought the shoes looked good, but it didn't take long to dislike them when I was at the beach. The soles of the water shoes collect rocks and debris which left me continuously picking stuff out of the soles while falling behind from my family. The tip of the shoes also peeled away after three days of using them. Needless to say, I don't bother cleaning them for my flight back home. I threw them away... Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Jones

customer_reviews.title: they are very painful they way they are stitched together on the top
customer_reviews.text: Had to return. they are very painful they way they are stitched together on the top. The minute I put them on I was surprised it felt like it was slicing into the tops of my feet. It's a shame because they looked nice too.
customer_reviews.author: David Fritch

customer_reviews.title: Very poor fabric ..
customer_reviews.text: Very poor fabric construction like a piece of paper with major wrinkles on the shoes face even when you put it on .. and does not look anything like the pictures .. won't survive alot in water ( arrived in a dirty plastic bag) .. do not recommend of course ..
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: They feel like your wearing nothing on your feet.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so comfortable. They're lightweight, dry quickly and are like wearing nothing. I've worn them to the beach, the lake and on the boat. I was nervous about buying them because of other reviewers having issues with rocks getting stuck in the bottom and I'm happy to say that I haven't had any issues with that. I've had these shoes about three weeks so far and they're holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: How true to fit they are.
customer_reviews.text: I love how light they are and I like wearing them around my pool so my feet don’t get hot from the concrete. If you aren’t sure about which size to order, I’d go up the half size. I wear anything from 11-12 1/2 with all the major shoe manufacturers and I’m glad I went with the 11 1/2 instead of the 11.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Poor build and material quality, picks up every rock, and has bad traction.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this pair of Aleaders for a trip to Hawaii for walking on the beach and beach trails. They started to fall apart at the end of the first day of use. By the end of my 7-day trip, the fabric mesh in between the ventilated sole and pad had torn in almost every location that there is a vent. There is virtually no arch support in these water shoes. The traction is sub-par and on a slightly damp sidewalk I lost my footing twice.
customer_reviews.author: Dave K.

customer_reviews.title: The aqua water shoe fits great. It is quality of the sewing
customer_reviews.text: The aqua water shoe fits great. It is quality of the sewing, more specifically in the tongue area. The tongues are only sewn on the bottom and have a tendency to get folded under unless your holding the top part. A pain. The right shoe tongue is barely hanging on. The left side of it has already disconnected itself from the shoe. So now the tongue drifts to the right all the time. Somehow I think a few of your shoes got past quality control. Would I recommend them? Yes but with serious reservation. A great throwaway shoe for a weeks vacation on the beach. But after that you would need a lot of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher L. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight and comfortable. It's a hot in the household for the PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the grey (Stylish) style and I loved them. Very light, soft soles, comfortable and breathable. I wear them around the house and for working out in the gym, they're great and I highly recommend them. Keep a few pairs around for people you don't want walking around your house with their dirty shoes on or bear foot. They have a really good shape when worn and looking down at them, like the Brooks Sneakers do.The lace you see on them is elastic and cannot be untied! Yet to try them out at the beach, but I do see rocks getting logged into the sole because of how the tread shape is.
customer_reviews.author: radiskull666

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I took my pair out fishing. They performed well as far as comfort. The sun does peek through the fabric of shoes a bit, enough that I felt the heat of the sun, but not enough for discomfort. Support is good after standing for a few hours and walking was good. But be mindful of the snug fit. My feet moved a bit in the shoe and when the shoes got wet the movement inside the shoe in creased, but not enough where it was uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: be aware of material mesh density
customer_reviews.text: fit a little small...also this pair had a much finer mesh so was clear that allowing sand to filter out was going to be an option. Strictly as a beach shoe that was going to be an issue...returned for a better fit as well as better mesh design for that purpose (and rated those higher accordingly). Free returns gets 5 stars. I was weary of purchasing from anyone who didnt offer for the very issue i ran into. was able to get the right size and style before my trip so while these weren't the right style shoes they were the right seller!
customer_reviews.author: Jason H

customer_reviews.title: Nice light aqua shoe for the price point.
customer_reviews.text: My foot is exactly 12”...and this shoe just leaves about 1/4 inch on the toes maybe just a bit more. I’m 6’4 at 196 lbs. I have a bit of wide foot at the top and this just fine. Not a ton of room but since its mostly mesh up top and foam bottom, there is not a lot of restriction. Testing it out in a few week for some RV camping that will be for 9 months. I’ll update my review then. For now, very light, fits well...and will test the grip once in water etc.,
customer_reviews.author: John Lovinggood

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Outdoor Water Shoe
customer_reviews.text: My friend had originally recommended this shoe to me when we had gone to visit a series of natural waterfalls you can swim in. So when it came time to trying to find a pair of shoes for white water rafting, these were my first choice. These were a perfect pair of shoes to have for my trip . They are super light and durable so were much better walking on the jagged rocks than my friends' flimsy "water socks". Plus, they look like normal athletic shoes that you can wear whenever. I would definitely recommend this to people who are wanting to go outdoors and be in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Good water shoes for a fair price
customer_reviews.text: Worked well with good traction. Used them to walk to the hot tub and to shower. Did not use in a rough environment. Size 13 fit my 13 4E foot fine. Did not cut into my ankles much but I don't think you could do a day hike in these without good socks which wont make sense anyways. Dried out quickly and did not hold water. SHould work great for wet landings off boats and rocky bottoms. Flexible so not a climbing or other shoe just nice to get wet and keep your feet off the ground or any yucky surface. Packs nice and small.
customer_reviews.author: bnucci24

customer_reviews.title: A Must Buy!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and went on a Caribbean vacation and I purchased these shoes so that he could wear them for a couple of excursions we went on. Little did I know they would be his daily beach/pool shoes, he never wore his flip flops! The shoes are true to fit and he said that they were extremely comfortable! If you go to the beach or pool you should definitely get these aqua shoes. When we returned from our trip he wanted to keep wearing them, I've hidden them for our next vacation!
customer_reviews.author: El

customer_reviews.title: durability and comfort
customer_reviews.text: My fiancee and I were looking for water shoes we could wear on the beach but also be able to use to get around on our trip to Thailand. These shoes are super light, easy to clean and pretty comfortable. I honestly did not think they were going to last the entire trip. They are well made and not only did they last our three weeks in Thailand but we will be using them again in a few months when we go to Hawaii. The shoes were used to walk to and from the beach to our hotel as well as three one hour hikes on rocks and dirt. Really good product. Feel better than the heavy traditional water shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable bad material
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is really uncomfortable, unfortunately I bought it during the time when I didn't need it thinking I'll need it in the future so didn't try it out so I can't return it anymore. But wanted to make sure others know so they don't make the same mistake I did. It scratches your skin, it uses some kind of hard plastic material everywhere so get some Neosporin ready to put all over your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Tempest

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a trip to Mexico and wore them the entire time! I even wore them to the airport! I have large feet for a woman. I normally wear a size 11 women but since my feel are also wide I normally but men shoes for things like this. I bought a 10 and they wore amazing! We walked a lot ! I wore them to a waterpark and rode bikes in them. These are some of the best shoes I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle Harding

customer_reviews.title: tale of two shoes
customer_reviews.text: these did not hold up. Bought in late march, 2019, and they have lost their inner lining for the sole, the sole itself is mis-shapen, and the shoe exterior is pulling away from the nose of each shoe. The first pair I bought were great, and in fact, i can still wear them comfortably (which is why i bought them again). I bought those in 2017, and they were fine, held up well, and didn't really need replacing, but i thought i'd get a new pair to take on our cruise... so, maybe they changed their manufacturing standards in 2 years? I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: L. BRACKEEN

customer_reviews.title: Great water shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! They fit nice and snug (like water shoes should) and look like nice sneakers. I took these out a few days ago for a long canoe trip and my feet stayed comfortable the whole time. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: White Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Great for amusement parks, bad for the beach.
customer_reviews.text: As a flat footed person, once you break them in after a few minutes of walking, they are quite comfortable. They do dry quickly. Unfortunately, these are not beach worthy which was the reason for buying them. They're just fine on dry sand, but sand immediately makes its way in once your in the water. Eventually, enough sand gets in that they become uncomfortable and youre trying to dust or rinse it out. Great for amusement parks, but bad for the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Obi-1

customer_reviews.title: Great water shoes, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Wore them for the first time today kayaking. They are much, much better than my old water shoes, which felt more like water socks compared to these. These have a decent sole so they feel like a shoe. They fit snugly but not too tight. They drain well and dry quickly. I used to get a lot of grit in my old shoes when launching and recovering but I didn't today wearing these. They are easy to put on due to the tongue and loop on the back. I didn't walk very far in them but for the bit that I did walk, they were very comfortable. They also look very nice I'm very happy with these water shoes!
customer_reviews.author: KBieb

customer_reviews.title: We absolutely LOVE these water shoes
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely LOVE these water shoes!!! I initially ordered a 10.5, my usual sneaker size, but found it to be a bit too small, so I ordered the 11 and it is perfect! My wife and I wore these on a zip lining/river tubing/riding horses through the ocean adventure trip in Jamaica, and they were incredible. Stayed on. Kept our feet cool. Protected our feet. They are incredibly light and airy, and it's easy to swim in them, walk over rocks and all sorts of terrain, and I just really want to buy like 5 more pairs of these :D :D Great for water parks, hiking, biking, even jogging.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Hagen

customer_reviews.title: White Water Rafting
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come off all day during white water rafting until the 7th and greatest falls where I was ejected from the raft. Only one came off BUT IT FLOATED TO THE TOP. What a pleasant surprise! I retrieved my shoe after 10 minutes and was back on my way. It was during a backpacking event. Did some light hiking in these too. Not hiking shoes, just noting that they're durable and comfortable. I'm not a complainer myself, but would be interested to hear from less rugged people than myself. This was my first backpacking trip of my life so...
customer_reviews.author: Ace Geo

customer_reviews.title: Great water shoe, Just not for me
customer_reviews.text: Bought for trip to Europe and needed something comfortable enough to walk in as well after reading reviews. My son who is 6’3” and wears a size 13. The shoe fit and is very comfortable for him since he has wide feet. The only negative for him is that he has a high (navicular) top part of foot and the seam stitching was causing it to feel tight and uncomfortable in that area (seam stitching for shoe lace). Returned and tried out another pair that worked out perfect for my son
customer_reviews.author: liza

customer_reviews.title: Great water/exploring shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes survived my maui trip! They dry quick, allow air flow so you don't sweat in them, but by far the best thing about them, they allow you to move around better than flip flops around rocky or sandy beaches!!! One caution, because of the drainage holes on the soles, you may have to dig out gravel that may get stuck, but I'll gladly take that inconvenience for not having shoes or sandles while exploring the coast. Thanks for reading, Aloha.
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: ALEADER Men's Quick Drying Aqua Water Shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes look nice and dry quickly. I bought a size 11, I normally wear a size 12 tennis shoe. They were still loose on my foot. I bought them for swimming in the river. I found them nice for a few minutes until they filled up with sand and rocks. When swimming I felt like they were going to come off my feet. I will have to continue my search for a good pair of river shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mr&MrsGriff

customer_reviews.title: Whitewater and wide feet approved
customer_reviews.text: Just took these for a trip on the Lower Yough, they served me well. They don't dry super quick but within a few hours they are basically dry. Had no problems with them staying on my feet and they gave me good grip when I inevitably fell into the water. For anyone with wide feet: I typically order 4E width, and roll my eyes at advice to buy normal shoes a half size up to account for width. However when it came to water shoes I couldn't find any wide ones so I just went with these. They were a little tight but since the material is all stretchy, they really will work for wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Adams

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for the price
customer_reviews.text: A good shoe for the money. I had to hike 2 miles into a spot on the river and they held up fine and i got no blisters. Feet were a bit sore when I got back to the truck but that was 4+ miles of hiking in them which they are not designed for. On the river I had good traction and my feet did not get cut up walking through rocks in and out of the water. They do tend to collect sand but that's just a trade off for good drainage. They fit as expected because I expected them to run slightly big. I wear a 9 so I got an 8.5.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Hawaii Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My Husband wanted something he could hike and wear around the island, as I was wearing a different style of shoe—but he needs more arch support as he has plantars fascitis. This was a recommended brand, and he figured for the price, he'd purchase. This ended up being the best idea, he could wear them in water, and they dried quickly. The only caveat was that some small pebbles got stuck in the sole here and there. Otherwise, great shoe for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: A. Guilmain

customer_reviews.title: Too Narrow
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to wear these on my upcoming vacation in Hawaii and I am going to be sending them back. I typically wear a Women's 10 1/2 WIDE width, so I figured a Men's 8.5 should suffice. Unfortunately, it was way too tight through the toe box and didn't show any sign of stretch in the material. Additionally, the way that it was packaged and sent left the foam bottom of the shoe warped. It's a great concept, but needs better execution.
customer_reviews.author: nightengale

customer_reviews.title: A Must at the Falls!
customer_reviews.text: So these were perfect for the occasion. Bought these to tour the Niagara Falls. I knew we would get ponchos, but what about our shoes?! These fit the bill. We wore them all day without socks and went from standing under the Falls to the street, back to the boat under the Falls and back to the street. These things did it all. The ONLY downside to these is that gravel do get lodged in the bottoms, which can be irritating. So I wouldn’t recommend hiking on gravel in these.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Parrott

customer_reviews.title: Shoe that lasts
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of picking up ten dollar water shoes at the beach stores, and after the third wearing, the inner lining has peeled off. This looked more substanial. I took mine to the Dead Sea and they don't show any wear at all! The waffle weave pattern of the bottom of the shoe Does trap a lot of sand. After drying, it felt like half a glass of sand came off the bottom of these, as wet sand gets trapped inside the three dimensional pattern of the soles.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for water areobics.
customer_reviews.text: What I really like about these is that they drain perfectly when you get out of the water. So many water shoes I've tried have a solid sole and the water pools in the bottom of the shoe. They never really dry out. No such problem with these shoes. In addition they provide good traction and what I consider to be reasonable arch support. I only wear mine when I work out in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Lainee S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, only used once
customer_reviews.text: I took these on a whitewater rafting trip and they performed very well. As a lot of the reviews mentioned, sand does get caught inside the shoe because of the mesh, but they were pretty easy to flush out. They were very comfortable and much more stylish than the alternatives. They also dried quick and provide just O.K. grip when climbing up wet rocks. Overall, I was happy with them for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Max E

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and drains well
customer_reviews.text: I needed some comfortable shoes that would drain well. These work perfectly. They were put to the test hiking to a waterfall in the rain on a mud covered trail. So they were quite wet and muddy but I hosed them off when I got back and they were back to normal the next day. They slip on and off easily and fit very well. If you need a lightweight quick draining shoe, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Gautreau

customer_reviews.title: Fit more like a Woman's shoe might.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a half size too big and it still seems too small and VERY narrow. The fabric does allow some give but my toes were all crunched up in front and my heel would have had blisters by the end of the day at the lake. I tried to like it but after trying it on and looking at it closer, for the price point I was expecting ALOT more and it just didn't seem to be there. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: K. M.

customer_reviews.title: A great water shoe!!
customer_reviews.text: Surpassed my expectations. Certainly worth paying a little more and getting what appears to be a well designed, attractive durable shoe. And so light weight. I am a "narrow" 9.5 and the 9.5 I bought "fits like a glove". Good value.
customer_reviews.author: GeneW

customer_reviews.title: Very good shoes, do exactly what they say they will
customer_reviews.text: Very good shoes, do exactly what they say they will. 100% washable but DO NOT PUT THEM IN THE DRYER. Shoes go through it fine, soles shrink dramatically. Need to be dried well after getting wet or they get extremely mungy extremely quickly (which happens to all things, but I think to these shoes faster than, say, a shirt in a corner or a jacket left folded up wet in a duffel bag).Good grip in the wet, though, really do shed water (I use them more as water shoes than boat shoes), very comfortable over long periods of wear and on city streets, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I do not buy shoes online. You never know how they are going to fit. However, due to the type of shoe in this case, I did purchase them online because 1) it is winter, and no retailers in my area had them, and 2) these shoes are stretchy by nature. I took the advice to buy my normal size, and that decision worked out perfectly! They fit great and certainly do the job in my newly adopted water aerobics class at the YMCA.
customer_reviews.author: mwsnelso

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value, ordering another pair now!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had several surgeries on my feet, so I need to be fussy about fit and comfort. Like other reviewers, I am thrilled with these shoes, especially (though not only) because of the price. I wore them on a 5k Pokemon walk today (in an old west style town with sub par sidewalks) and found them to be wonderful. The sole is more than thick enough to absorb rocks and big cracks in the sidewalk. The waffle pattern in the sole is a clever way to make these things feather light. I’m thinking that these will be my best friends on long plane flights. I’m ordering another pair tonight! Honestly, don’t think about these. Just order them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fitting shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice shoe. Purchased to use in rainy weather while walking big city streets. As a water shoe I did not put to the test yet because it didn't rain as expected. Therefore I am unable comment on the effectiveness of the shoe in wet conditions. I can say that the shoes are very lightweight, fit comfortably (both with and without socks), true to my size. Looks like a sneaker, a nice looking sneaker at that. Not the look of a typical water shoe. Walked for miles in them on pavement/sidewalks without the slightest issue. Very impressed by this product.
customer_reviews.author: Music Lovin Mark

customer_reviews.title: top of my feet feels like they're burning
customer_reviews.text: top of my feet feels like they're burning, it does not keep sand out whatsoever, used it once and basically threw it away because of how painful it was.
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Seemed Good, but Made Way Small
customer_reviews.text: The shoes seemed to be made well, and be of decent quality. They look really great too, but they run extremely small. I wear men's size 13, and at first I couldn't get the shoe on because the opening wouldn't stretch enough for my foot to fit inside. Once I loosened the elastic laces all the way, I was barely able to get my foot in, but my toes were curled up at the end because the shoe was made so short. I would have liked to keep them, but they were just unwearable.
customer_reviews.author: JLyle

customer_reviews.title: You can walk on sand and not get feet burned
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Dry super quick i used thin socks with them Shoes don’t smell too bad with no socks but i only used for 2 days with no socks Helps climbing over rocks and pebbles Cons: Pebbles can get stuck on the bottom and you could feel them My shoes got a hole from the sole am guessing from rocks I didn’t feel it If you step on anything like a little puddle you can feel the water at the bottom of your feet which is something I didn’t expect. I ordered 10.5 and it felt at first a bit loose but not loose when i was walking i usually wear a 0 to 10.5
customer_reviews.author: Hank TK

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Worn weekly for 6 months. Excellent grip while fishing on a boat. Extremely light and cooler than regular boat shoes. Drains immediately and dries quickly. Because of drainage soles and mesh uppers, I don't think they would good for the beach or sandy bottom water wear. Hope they last a few years, but when these wear out, I would definitely consider buying another pair.
customer_reviews.author: randall ashimine

customer_reviews.title: If the upper mesh above the toes were not porous then the shoes would have worked better. I do not recommend for ocean beaches
customer_reviews.text: I think these might have run a little large. I wear an 11.5 but could only order a 12. I thought these shoes would drain well and they did. But all the pores in the toes allowed the beach sand to go in but not out. If the upper mesh above the toes were not porous then the shoes would have worked better. I do not recommend for ocean beaches. They would work well for rivers or possibly lakes.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: For a pool they would work great. But not  in sand and mud at river
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't to happy with this shoe. If your by a pool they would work great but in the river the mud and sand just kept getting in between my foot and shoe constantly. The netting holes is to large. I used them one whole weeked kayaking and camping but ordered a different kind
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not quite perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this style of shoe. The only downside is, in light waves (i.e. in 2-3 inches of water), the waves bring in sand and shells that go into the shoe. Design flaw, but is standard for this type of shoe. Also, very difficult to walk on a sandy beach, as the sand just pours into the shoe. However, for actual use IN the water, these are great. Also rugged and great for walking over heavy terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Crazed in Black

customer_reviews.title: Great Lightweight Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love these things! As close to being barefoot as you can get, and they take no time to dry if you get them wet. It can be a pain to get a stone out of the bottom if you step on one just right, but I wouldn't have known it was there except I had one shoe suddenly turn into a tap shoe. Very comfortable and the size I ordered fit exactly as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Voracious Reader

customer_reviews.title: good looking, good for short walks but you do not want to go hiking wearing these.
customer_reviews.text: Nice water shoes. reason for 4/5 stars is 1) The tongue keeps getting pushed into the show when putting them on. Wish they had a way to keep this from happening. Other than that they are great shoes. 2) I did have an issue with gravel/rocks getting stuck in the bottom of the shoe while walking. The soft flexible sole of the shoe makes it prone for this. Other than that I love the shoes. Don't think I would want to walk in them all day (hiking). They are good for the beach or for short walks.
customer_reviews.author: Dick Darlington

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you go to the beach
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes to go to Hawaii and was looking forward to using them. Once I put them on the first time there and walked in the sand I had sand all in them. So I was like ok once I get in the water the sand would go right through well that didn't happen it stayed mostly in the shoes. Also I should have listen to the review about the comfort of the shoe on your foot itches and it leaves red marks all over your feet where the seems are. Not comfortable due to the fabric and seem location
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. I wore these to Cedar Point, a huge theme park, where I have never made it through the day without my feet being tore up and sore as hell, no matter what shoes I have tried. While wearing these, my feet felt absolutely amazing all day. I couldn't shut up talking to my wife about it and how comfortable I was by the end of the day. These are awesome shoes. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a wet shoe, or even shoes to casually bop around in during the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Barron

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and great for walking around!
customer_reviews.text: We bought a pair of these for each of us before our Hawaiian vacation this year and they were great. They allow a lot of sand into them but swishing your feet around in the water can easily work most of it out. They were great for the coral and rocky surfaces we encountered. I like the fact they feel like a tennis shoe and not like you are walking flat-footed on the ground like a normal "aqua sock". The only negative thing is that they can get larger stones caught in the holes on the sole, but they can easily be removed when you take the shoes off.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M Schwaller

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I do not leave very many reviews. Usually only if an item is very good or very bad. In this case, these shoes were very good. I bought a pair to use outside when playing with my children in the kiddie pool in our backyard, but I ended up buying a second pair just to wear around the house. The shoes slip on very well and are just the right size. Additionally, they are extremely comfortable and have replaced the slippers I used to wear in the house. You can’t go wrong with these shoes for whatever purpose you want to use them for.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Stieringer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for the beach
customer_reviews.text: I got these for an Island trip, and they were so close to being awesome except one major issue: the quick drying fabric has too big of holes! Every time I went into the ocean she'll fragments and other ocean gunk would get stuck in the same seam. I'd even take the shoes off once I was in the water to try to fix it, but still ended up with two scabs on my feet. Outside of that these are very lightweight and dry quickly. They were great for boating and jet skiing, just not to protect your feet in the watee.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Zinda

customer_reviews.title: Metatarsal pain is defeated!
customer_reviews.text: I have severe metatarsal pain to the point that I cannot go barefoot or even just wear socks. I wear shoes with padded inserts constantly. So going swimming or into a pool is difficult. These are the best water shoes that I have worn. I was able to go in the pool and hot tub with them comfortably - without inserts. I was skeptical at first but thought I'd try them and was very pleasantly surprised. Thanks for helping me to enjoy a piece of life again!
customer_reviews.author: TMH

customer_reviews.title: Look good but fabric ungluing
customer_reviews.text: Shoe fits and functions as expected. Returned the first pair after only two hours of wear due to fabric in the toe area coming unglued and making it very uncomfortable on my toes. 2nd pair now has about 5hours wear and I’m afraid the same piece of fabric is beginning to come loose. This doesn’t inhibit the functionality of the shoe, just the comfort. I may have to cut the fabric out with a knife if it gets worse.
customer_reviews.author: My Name is Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but cut my Achilles’ tendon
customer_reviews.text: Great water shoe but I don’t know if it was my pair that I received or my sissy Achilles’ but they got tore up and just overly irritated to the point I couldn’t wear them. Maybe they’ll get better but I have worn them for about 5 full day’s and they’re still getting “broken in”. I’ll update if it gets better or what I have to do to make them not cut my Achilles’ tendon.
customer_reviews.author: bryce egelin

customer_reviews.title: Overall very pleased & would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Shoes were light & drained water very well -- plus dried fairly quickly. The soles were tougher than thought would be -- wore them on portage trails in Quetico Prov. park canoe area & held up very well. Also didn't feel rocks or anything else come through the bottom drain holes. Only issue was the stretchy tongue rubbed skin raw some on top of foot( no socks), but that might have been due to high top of my foot & being wet for excessive time. Overall very pleased & would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Kearby

customer_reviews.title: Secure fit and good function for a day of water fun.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes not only felt good, but worked good. So far i have only used them for one full day of very active water fun, including a tug-o-way; where other peoples water shoes were slipping off or breaking straight through the stitching. At first, i had a slight discomfort/chafe where the band of stitching went across the upper of the shoe; though as the day went on... i didn't notice it at all. Have already recommended these shoes to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Bigrob55

customer_reviews.title: Great water shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes to take with me to Hawaii and they did not disappoint. They were extremely comfortable and fit as described. The soles are a big upgrade to regular water shoes and stylish enough to forget they are water shoes and wear them around as regular shoes through out the day. At least that's how it panned out for me. I ware them around town and the beach. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for a 7 nighter in the Boundary Waters. I knew they'd take a beating with all the portages and shore lunches, and they held up very well. I never had an issue with the inserts. The mesh was perfect: very small rocks that didn't bother me kind of came and went but the big ones never made it through. They dried fast and had plenty of grip when walking on boulders to climb waterfalls. They're definitely not in a condition to last another trip, but for the price, can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a shoe that was breathable so i could wear without socks. The holes in the bottom are genius. The only issues are if you walk in rocks those holes pick up the rocks. Also, zero arch support so don't expect these to be good on your knees.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Opening the shoes. They look nice in the photo but super cheap when you get them. The bottoms aren't flat but rounded. So it hard to walk on them. There also is a crease line I noticed at the heal and the ball of the foot. It looks warped. Just putting them on you can tell it's cheap netting and plastic/rubberish sole. I highly do not recomend. You can tell it's a cheap knock off from China. For $35 dollars you can get better water shoes from Target or Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend them.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like good quality water shoes but quickly found out that wearing them for even a short period of time you get blisters on your Achilles. You basically can't wear them without socks or band aids to reduce the pain. Have asks for a refund twice from seller who acknowledged the issue but they do not respond. Stay away from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Sequoia

customer_reviews.title: Wide Feet
customer_reviews.text: My feet are Naturally wide, while these are not the widest shoes they did stretch in order to fit my feet, the soles never slipped in the shoe and it was very comfortable. I noticed a lot of my friends had the ones you get from Walmart or Academy, these actually looked and felt like regular shoes, not once did they feel bogged down with water and they did drain fast. I wouldn't go hiking in these as the backs of them are slightly rough and i can see blisters forming after long periods of walking.
customer_reviews.author: OverDrive

customer_reviews.title: Ultralight hiker river crossing option.
customer_reviews.text: Weight: At 8 and 3/4 oz (if you pull out the shoe inserts) with a good snug fit these are the lightest and best river crossing shoes. Dry time: less than 1 hour if hiking. Stability: not a lot but much more than a croc and much more than a slipper. I feel pretty safe crossing water I can't see the bottom in. Hiking: I don't use them much after they dry while on the hike since little peebles get stuck in the drain holes. But if I'm around town these have become my go to beech and errand shoe as well. Mesh is super breathable.
customer_reviews.author: Hanz Blatt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lightweight shoe
customer_reviews.text: I got them for a two week backpacking trip as an around the camp shoe. They worked great and stood up to the abuse. Nice and lightweight and easy to pack which is why I got them. They handled a couple 2-3 mile day hikes without issue and had great grip in water on slippery granite. I consider these somewhat disposable though in the sense that they'd probably only last one more backpacking trip. In less aggressive environments, they would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for some nice water shoes for going to the pool
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for some nice water shoes for going to the pool, washing car, etc. These are great. Very nice look, hold no water and have held up well into this short summer. Preparing for a beach/resort vacation where I will wear these all-day, every-day. Looking forward to see how the hold up. If you are looking for shoes to go to the river in that will stay on in rapids, etc; these are not your shoes (think of those ugly old water shoes they wore in the early 90's). These slide on/off easy, but stay in place while normal walking/running around. I bought for the later and couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Parker

customer_reviews.title: amazing water shoes for the money
customer_reviews.text: have heal and toe (big toe arthritis) issues and can’t walk on my boat or dock barefoot. the fabric stretches over the toes so never bothers them. and just enough cushion for the heels. Where these inside the house over tile and also walk the dog in them often when it rains. great for walking knee or waste deep in the bay too. love these so much i bought a second pair. life savers.
customer_reviews.author: snooze13

customer_reviews.title: Great water shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned water shoes before so this was something new to me. Also I have 2x wide feet and from reading it sounded like these were a little wide which they were which was perfect for me feet. I do wish they had better arch support but for the price they were a great value. Also they don't dry fast in Florida due to the humidity so either bring them in to the A/C or put them on shoe drying rack in your dryer on low.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Frericks

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: They fit and work well. I have flat feet so I need something without a big arch. I usually have to spend time trying several different brands, etc. If you wear these all day, you'll know they don't have much support but they're good at what they do.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Useful in Many Ways
customer_reviews.text: I got these shoes because, a few years ago, Zebra Mussels invaded our lake. They are dying off, but they will still cut one's feet to ribbons. I was simply looking for something to protect my feet while working in the lake, but these shoes exceed expectations. No cheap water moccasins, they! These are great for a run, or for yard work, or just putzing around. Comfortable, solid, and useful. They've done the job for which I got them, and more. Dumb luck got me a great pair of shoes :-)
customer_reviews.author: Sean Connelly

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for recent beach side trip
customer_reviews.text: Great slip on pool/beach shoe. Took these on a recent trip to Mexico after previous encounters with rough pool bottoms, nasty beaches and slick sucio bathroom floors. They fit well with great breathability. They stayed on the entire time and did not fill up with sand on the beach. Good price and good experience.
customer_reviews.author: damocles

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I took a 12 day vacation to Costa Rica. We were these on the beach, in the water, ATV tour, zip lining, and just walking around. Very light, dry fast, and aerated. We bought a pair for her and myself and loved them. Ran into another guy and he said "these are great" My brother in law bought waterproof shoes and he tried mine on and wished he had gotten these.
customer_reviews.author: wys99backup

customer_reviews.title: Order at least one size larger to fit properly.
customer_reviews.text: The product was exactly what I wanted except it did not match my shoe size. 1st pair, size 13, was to short but otherwise perfect. 2nd size 14 pair I purchased was also to short. In fact it must have been mislabeled because it fit exactly the same as the size 13. I love the shoe. It was light, right color, fit my width perfectly, and gave great arch support; it just was not long enough.
customer_reviews.author: J DFreeman

customer_reviews.title: Nice little shoes for water sports.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the shoes overall and fit pretty well. The arch support is not great. The width is a little narrow but they fit snug. The material is light and dries quickly. I think these will make For great boat shoes and kayak. Overall I rate them 8-9 out of 10. Would buy again and especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great Looking Water Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a cruise to Jamaica and Mexico where we needed water shoes to climb waterfalls and go into underground caves. These were perfect and they look good too. They look like regular shoes! They didn't believe that we were wearing watersheds and were concerned about us going in the water with them. They were comfortable and we ended up wearing them around the ship. I wear a size 8 and have a wide foot. I purchased a size 8 and they were secure on my foot, but not too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie

customer_reviews.title: These are a great pair of river shoes & shoes in general !!
customer_reviews.text: I've used several shoes over the several decades of fishing in rivers & these shoes are the best out of the box !!!! PROS: The shoes fit exactly as I expected. I experienced very little slippage while walking around. They dried within an hour of being out of the water. They are extremely comfortable (so comfortable I'm ordering another pair for non-fishing purposes). CONS: They are easily stained. The very small river pebbles can & likely will end up inside of the shoe, which become uncomfortable. Great alternative to wading boots & much, much less expensive !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stay on your feet and insoles stay in place.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried others, but they do not compare to these. I do water aerobics in the lazy river. The others do not have the athletic type sole for better traction. The first time I used the others, the insoles would slide right out of the shoe. Not these. For the small increase in price, you get a shoe that works! We call them my Pat Boone shoes. God bless you Pat.
customer_reviews.author: dbear

customer_reviews.title: Smaller fit than expected...
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the look of these shoes, and my only complaint is they seem to fit about 1 size smaller than you'd expect. I actually ordered a little bit larger than I wear because I wasn't sure... but they were still too small. Had I got the right size I'm sure I would love them, so I wouldn't discourage anyone from buying them... just go at least 1 size up. Unfortunately my first trip in them was across the beach so I didn't feel good about returning them, since they'd been worn... so I'm stuck with them!
customer_reviews.author: Lee E.

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome and a great alternative to traditional "water socks
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome and a great alternative to traditional "water socks." Much less foot and leg fatigue because of the excellent heel support (for a water shoe anyway). I would recommend ordering a half size smaller than usual to get a good, secure fit (so they don't slip off in the water), I typically wear a US M10.5 and wear a 10 in these.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These have to be the most comfortable shoes I have ever worn. I wear them to work. They look like a casual shoe. I have a very difficult time finding a comfortable shoe but these are "awesome". They are soft on my heels. As a water shoe they were a bit shocking one day when I walked through a puddle because I'd forgotten that they are open on the bottom. Would really love to find this identical product without the "water" part so I could wear them year round. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and rugged
customer_reviews.text: I ususally don't leave reviews for products, but wanted to for this product because I was impressed with these water shoes. I went on a vacation to the caribbean. I had brought a pair of sandles, which turned out to hurt my feet. I had no other shoes to wear at the resort and didn't want to get ripped off by paying a forturne with a new pair of sandles. I tried the water shoes on, and they fit great and felt great! I wore them the entire time on my trip, and had no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: EO

customer_reviews.title: beach shoe, with good sole
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to run in these, but close to a running shoe with open top. the sole is thick rubber, and a decent shoe. update: the tongue doesn't stay in place, so everytime you need to pull it out to put your shoe on. -subtract a star, should have a strap to hold tongue in place.
customer_reviews.author: WildBill

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Love these!!! My husband needs shoes that are quick drying for work and these work great! Bought a cheaper version before, and they worked well but wore out quickly. These seem to be a more durable material and are very stylish. Great product, highly recommended... I just wish they would offer more colors in size 13 that are the more durable material!
customer_reviews.author: BeTalvy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit nicely and are very comfortable in and out of the water. I have a pebble tec pool and wanted something that would allow me to do some walking and other exercise in the pool without tearing up my feet. These are perfect. Quick drying and very easy to put on / take off when wet.
customer_reviews.author: C Mc

customer_reviews.title: but with usage the fit has become more comfortable. They work great in the water
customer_reviews.text: I wear 11 and these 11's were just a bit snug mostly on the top of my foot, but with usage the fit has become more comfortable. They work great in the water, on the beach and walking over sharp lake gravel. The sand also cleans out fairly easily. Small rocks can get stuck in the tread holes, but they are easily removed. They look good also. The insert can be pulled out to assist with cleaning and it goes easily back in without bunching or rolling up.
customer_reviews.author: Brad B.

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced Junk
customer_reviews.text: 50 cent made in Communist Regime of China plastic shoe sold for $30 - poor arch, nylon "netting" thin and flimsy, my foot size 9 yet size 10 barely good, 10.5 probably better. For $30 I really expected more, this shoe is underwhelming for the price and really should cost $10. Four days of wear and already abnormal deformation on front sides, I forecast the shoes will barely last the summer. Will certainly not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Goldsborough

customer_reviews.title: No lacing system to tighten shoes to feet.
customer_reviews.text: Reviews were very positive on this item so I bought. Very disappointed however on arrival. These water shoes offer NO TIGHTENING SYSTEM to secure to feet. Its simply a slip on woth very “limp” shockcord that will undoubtedly lose all resilience after a few wears. Cool looking? Yes. Ill call it “ALL SIZZLE BUT NO STEAK”
customer_reviews.author: YKNOTR

customer_reviews.title: They do work great if your at a lake, by the pool, or just outside when it's wet.
customer_reviews.text: These were a little larger than I expected, but they do work great. My only negative is that these really do not work for rocky or sandy terrain. I got them for the beach and river walking, but small rocks can go through the holes in the bottom and get into the show. They do work great if your at a lake, by the pool, or just outside when it's wet.
customer_reviews.author: john solberg

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to give these shoes a 5 because they ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give these shoes a 5 because they fit perfectly. After a few uses in the local lake, they started to obtain a typical lake/mildew smell. I decided to soak them in some soapy water overnight and then toss in with a load of towels the next morning to dry. This ruined the shoes and they can no longer be worn. The material buckled and I ended up pitching them in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Trey M.

customer_reviews.title: WOW did this drain fast!
customer_reviews.text: If you know you are going to get wet, but want a shoe experience, get these. Water sport shoes go in two directions: amazing seal to keep you dry, or amazing drainage to let your feet breathe. I swear my shoe drained before I was able to land my next step. Can't wait to try these with my kayak.
customer_reviews.author: PRANTZ

product_meta.title: ALEADER Men's Outventure Quick Drying Aqua Water Shoes
feature_bullets: Breathable and durable synthetic/mesh upper allow the foot to breathe
Solyte midsole provides an exceptionally lightweight midsole with excellent bounce-back and durability
Water Drain outsole provides exceptional traction in wet and slippery conditions
ComforDry sockliner provides the optimum cushioning performance that creates a cooler, drier and healthier shoe environment.
Open mesh on the upper and hole on the sole provides for superior breathability and quick drying
